channel.title: JRR Tolkien on un01s notes
channel.description: Recent content in JRR Tolkien on un01s notes

item.description: “Stories – frankly, human stories are always about one thing – death. The inevitability of death.” He then read aloud from that article, which quoted from Simone de Beauvoir’s A Very Easy Death, her moving 1964 account of her mother’s desire to cling to life during her dying days. “There is no such thing as a natural death,” he read. “Nothing that happens to a man is ever natural, since his presence calls the world into question.
